intro: Hieracium variicolor, commonly known as the variable hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are basal and have a rough texture, while its flowering stems are usually unbranched. Hieracium variicolor is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
